Scheme Name: State Merit Scholarship to Under Graduate Girls Students
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a girl.
1. The applicant should be a student.
1. The applicant should have passed 10+2 with at least 60% marks.
1. The applicant should be pursuing an undergraduate general degree course in a Government College in Haryana.
1. The applicant should not hold any other scholarship or stipend.
1. The applicant may accept a grant for books, equipment, boarding, or lodging from the State Government or other sources.
1. There is no income limit for availing of this scholarship.
**Preference/Priority**
If multiple students secure the same marks, priority will be given based on:
- Marks are calculated up to three decimal places.
- If still tied, the younger applicant will get priority.
Description & Benefits:
"Merit Scholarship to Undergraduate Girl Students"  aims to promote higher education among meritorious girl students by providing a scholarship amount of ₹3,000 per annum to 10 eligible girl students per government college who have excelled in their 10+2 examination.
**Scholarship Amount**
- ₹3,000/- per student per annum.
- Awarded to 10 girl students per government college.
**Conditions for Scholarship Renewal**
- The scholarship is tenable for three years during undergraduate studies.
- To continue receiving the scholarship, the applicant must secure at least 55% marks in the qualifying examination each year.
- If an applicant cannot appear for the annual exam due to illness, renewal may be granted upon submission of a valid medical certificate approved by the Head of the Institution.
**Mode Disbursement**
- Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
**Validity**
- Only for students pursuing general academic courses in Government Colleges.
- Scholarship renewal depends on satisfactory progress and conduct.
- The scholarship may be revoked or changed at any time at the discretion of the government.
Application Process:
> **Registration**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the menu ribbon, click "Student > [Student Registration](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/StudentRegistration)".
**Step 3:** On the next page, provide your Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID) and click "Search".
_*Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) is mandatory for availing of any Scholarship benefit. Students are advised to ensure their all particulars such as Name, DOB, Aadhar No. etc are fully updated in PPP before applying for any scholarship scheme._
**Step 4:** A List of the members of your family will be displayed. Select the checkbox against your name and click "Generate OTP". Enter the OTP received on your registered Mobile Number and click on "Verify OTP".
**Step 5:** After OTP verification, you will be taken to the registration page. In the registration form, all the mandatory fields get auto-filled. You only need to cross-check the information.
**Step 6:** Select your Department and College. Create a Password and click "Register".
> **Application**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the right corner of the menu ribbon, click "[User Login](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/UserLogin)". Use the username and password created during your registration to log in.
**Step 3:** Navigate to the online form of the scheme you intend to apply for. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections.
**Step 4:** Click "Apply" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message.
Tags: Education, Girl, Graduation, Merit, Scholarship, Stipend, Student

Scheme Name: Stipend Scheme for Grandchildren of Freedom Fighters
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a grandchild (third generation) of a freedom fighter.
1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
1. The applicant should be enrolled in a government or government-aided college/university in Haryana.
1. The applicant should be pursuing a non-professional course.
1. The applicant should have passed the previous examination based on which admission was granted.
1. The applicant should maintain satisfactory attendance and conduct.
1. The applicant should not have failed the previous year’s university examination.
**Reinstatement Criteria:**
If a student drops out but re-joins classes and maintains at least 50% attendance for three months, the previous and current quarter’s stipend is released.
Description & Benefits:
"Stipend Scheme for Grandchildren of Freedom Fighters" aims to honour the third-generation descendants of freedom fighters by providing financial assistance for higher education. Eligible students receive a monthly stipend and an annual allowance for books to support their education.
**Financial Assistance**
Eligible students receive ₹1,000 per month as a stipend for 12 months and ₹2,000 per year as an allowance for books.
**Coverage**
The scheme applies to students pursuing non-professional courses in government and government-aided colleges and universities in Haryana.
**Good Conduct Requirement**
Scholarship installments are released only upon obtaining a good conduct and attendance certificate from the principal/head of the institution.
**Reinstatement Condition**
If a student drops out but re-joins and attends at least 50% of classes in three months, both the previously due installment and the current quarter’s installment are released.
**Mode of Disbursement**
- Payment is made via electronic transaction to the student’s bank account.
- In exceptional cases, payment may be made through a demand draft.
**Frequency of Disbursement**
The stipend is paid in four instalments per year:
- September: For July & August
- November: For September & October
- January: For November & December
- March: For January to June
Application Process:
> **Registration**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the menu ribbon, click "Student > [Student Registration](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/StudentRegistration)".
**Step 3:** On the next page, provide your Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID) and click "Search".
_*Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) is mandatory for availing of any Scholarship benefit. Students are advised to ensure their all particulars such as Name, DOB, Aadhar No. etc are fully updated in PPP before applying for any scholarship scheme._
**Step 4:** A List of the members of your family will be displayed. Select the checkbox against your name and click "Generate OTP". Enter the OTP received on your registered Mobile Number and click on "Verify OTP".
**Step 5:** After OTP verification, you will be taken to the registration page. In the registration form, all the mandatory fields get auto-filled. You only need to cross-check the information.
**Step 6:** Select your Department and College. Create a Password and click "Register".
> **Application**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the right corner of the menu ribbon, click "[User Login](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/UserLogin)". Use the username and password created during your registration to log in.
**Step 3:** Navigate to the online form of the scheme you intend to apply for. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections.
**Step 4:** Click "Apply" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message.
Tags: Education, Financial Assistance, Scholarship, Stipend, Student

Scheme Name: INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban)
Eligibility Criteria:
- The applicant should be from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.
- The applicant should be from an urban area.
- The applicant should be a local resident of a district of Andhra Pradesh.
- The applicant should not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.
- The applicant should be 65 years of age or above.
- The applicant should be destitute (with little or no means of subsistence and no family or relative to depend upon).
_*The eligible citizens will be identified by their respective Ward Sabhas. The register containing the list of eligible citizens will be shared by the Bill Collector with the Municipal Commissioner._
Description & Benefits:
"INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban)" scheme aims to provide monthly pensions to destitute elderly persons aged 65 years or above with little or no means of subsistence and no family or relative to depend upon. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, and be a resident of Andhra Pradesh.
**Pension Amount:** The scale of benefit under the pension will be notified by the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
**Mode of Disbursement:** The Bill Collector disburses the pension to the eligible individuals in the presence of Ward members and office bearers of DWCUA.
**Time of Disbursement:** The pension is disbursed on the first date of every month.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** **Identification of Eligible Persons**
The Ward Sabha identifies eligible persons based on the eligibility criteria. A ward-wise register of eligible persons (Part A for existing pensioners, Part B for new eligible persons) is maintained by the Bill Collector.
**Step 2:** **Recommendation and Sanction**
The Bill Collector sends Ward Sabha resolution recommending eligible persons to the Municipal Commissioner.
The Municipal Commissioner scrutinizes eligibility and sanctions pensions based on municipality-wise allocation.
**Step 3:** **Disbursement of Pensions**
The Project Director (DRDA) sends pension acquittance list and funds to Municipal Commissioners.
The Municipal Commissioner issues cheques to Bill Collectors.
The Bill Collector disburses pensions to pensioners in the presence of Ward members and DWCUA office bearers.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Old Age, Pension, Senior Citizen, Urban

Scheme Name: Goa State Financial Incentives to the Industries for Certification and Patenting Scheme, 2008
Eligibility Criteria:
- Units that obtained Certification from the Indian Standard Institute, International Standard Organization Certification, or any other National/International certification for quality standards from Re-certifying bodies accorded by the Government, NABCB (National Accreditation Board for Certification Bodies), etc., and/or patent rights on products and/or processes were eligible.
- Units had to be under the category of Micro & Small/Medium and large-scale industry or service industry falling under the Green/Orange Category list.
- Units permanently registered or acknowledged with Entrepreneurs Memorandum II by the Director of Industries, Trade and Commerce were eligible.
- Units not registered or acknowledged with EM II but cleared by the High Powered Coordination Committee or any Committee or Authority formed to grant such clearances for investment in the State were also eligible.
- Service Industries not covered under sub-clauses (a) and (b) were also eligible if they fell under the following categories:
1. Hospitals or any other Medical Institutions registered with or recognized by the Directorate of Health Services.
1. Educational Institutions recognized by the Directorate of Education/Directorate of Higher Education/Directorate of Technical Education or any other educational institution affiliated to Goa University/Goa Board/Goa Board of Technical Education or any other institution covered under the Goa Education Development Corporation or Human Resource Development Foundation.
1. Co-operative Banks other than Multi-State Co-operative Banks registered with the Registrar of Co-operative Societies under the Government of Goa.
1. Any other service sector specially notified for this purpose by the Director, Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce.
- Units could obtain financial incentives under this Scheme only once in the lifetime of the unit after permanent registration.
- Units that had already obtained Certification or patent rights but had not availed any financial assistance from the State Government were also eligible to apply for incentives under this Scheme for additional certification, provided the certification qualified for the benefit under this Scheme.
- Units that had availed Central assistance for this purpose were also eligible but only to the extent of the balance amount after deducting the Central Assistance availed.
- Units that lost certification due to inadequacies in the unit were not eligible to avail the benefit for the second time.
Description & Benefits:
"Goa State Financial Incentives to the Industries for Certification and Patenting Scheme" aimed to encourage industrial units to obtain certifications and patents for quality standards. It provided financial assistance up to ₹2,00,000/- to eligible industries and service sectors.
- Financial assistance/subsidy to the extent of ₹2,00,000/- or the actual expenses incurred, whichever was less, was granted per unit.
- The actual expenses did not include charges for lodging/boarding, refreshments, travel, etc., but included only the actual charges incurred to obtain the certificate.
- Financial incentives could be availed once in the lifetime of the unit, irrespective of changes in ownership/constitution or product.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant had to obtain the specified proforma from the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce. Alternatively, the prescribed format could also be downloaded from the official website of the Directorate.  
**Step 2:** The applicant was required to take a print of the form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).  
**Step 3:** The duly filled and signed application form, along with the documents, had to be submitted to the **Director, Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce. The Director of Industries, Trade and Commerce** would scrutinize the application and verify the eligibility of the unit. This process was completed within three months from the date of application submission.
> **Approval and Disbursement**
Once the application was approved, the financial assistance/subsidy was used to disburse within six months from the date of receiving the application. The amount used to be up to ₹2,00,000/- or the actual expenses incurred, whichever is less.
Tags: Certification, Incentive, Industry, MSME, Patent

Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Assistance for Interest Subsidy (Manufacturing Sector)
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The firm must be a Micro/Small/Medium enterprise.
   1. The enterprise must be in the manufacturing sector.
   1. The term loan must be sanctioned by a recognized Bank/Financial Institution (excluding NBFCs).
   1. The enterprise must apply within one year of loan disbursement or before the commercial production starts.
   1. The enterprise must remain operational for at least 7 years post-subsidy approval.
   1. The enterprise must comply with pollution control measures.
   1. Only one type of investment (Forward Integration, Backward Integration, Diversification, or Expansion) will be eligible for subsidy.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.
**Financial Assistance:**
**Category of Taluka** **Quantum of Incentive**  [Category I](https://imd.gujarat.gov.in/Document/I%20Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98.pdf)7% on Term Loan with a maximum amount of ₹35,00,000/- per annum for a period of 7 years[Category II](https://imd.gujarat.gov.in/Document/I%20Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98.pdf)6% on Term Loan with a maximum amount of ₹30,00,000/- per annum for a period of 6 years [Category III](https://imd.gujarat.gov.in/Document/I%20Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98.pdf) &amp;amp;amp; Municipal Corporation Areas5% on Term Loan with a maximum amount of ₹25,00,000/- per annum for a period of 5 years
Application Process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step-1:** Visit the [Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP)](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/) portal. Click on "New Investor Registration" to access the registration form. **Step-2:** Fill in the Registration Form. Click on "Submit". **Step-3:** Verify the E-mail ID using the link sent on your registered E-mail ID. **Step-4:** After verification, you will be registered successfully.
> **Post-Registration Process:** **Step-1:** Visit the [Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP)](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/) portal. Click on "Login". **Step-2:** Enter the email address and password you used during registration. **Step-3:** Click the "Login" button to access your account. **Step-4:** Now fill in the required details and mandatory documents about your business to complete the application process.
> **Helpdesk:** [**Contact Here.**](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/IFP-pages/contact.jsp?pagedisp=static)
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, Interest Subsidy, MSMEs, Start Up

Scheme Name: Jharkhand Mukhyamantri Shramik Yojana
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be an unskilled worker willing to work in urban areas.
1. The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand and living in an urban local body (own/rented/slum) since before April 1, 2015.
1. The applicant should be 18 years or older.
1. The disabled person, women in special circumstances, and senior citizens above 65 years are also eligible to apply.
Description & Benefits:
The "Mukhyamantri Shramik Yojana" scheme by the Urban Development & Housing Department, Government of Jharkhand aims to provide guaranteed employment to unskilled urban workers. It offers up to 100 days of employment in urban development projects. - Guaranteed wage employment for a maximum of 100 days per financial year. - Improvement in living standards of urban poor families. - Employment opportunities in urban development projects like housing, sanitation, and road construction. - Ensuring social security for urban workers. - Contribution to urban cleanliness and green city initiatives.
***Job Card Issuance:*** - Job cards can be obtained online, through community resource persons, urban local body offices, or ward-level camps. - Job card valid for 3 years with provisions for member addition/removal.
***Job Allocation Process:*** - Workers can demand work online or through community resource persons. - Employment is assigned within 15 working days. - Job allocation details are sent via SMS and can be accessed on the portal.
Application Process:
***Job Card Apply Process:***
- Visit the official website of Mukhyamantri Shramik Yojana: msy.jharkhand.gov.in
- Click on the "Application" link/button.
- Select "Apply for Job Card".
- Fill out the form with the required information, such as your address, Aadhaar card number, mobile number, etc.
- If you need to add additional family members, click on the "Add More" button and fill in their details.
- Accept the terms and conditions and complete the captcha verification.
- Click on the "Submit" button.
- Your job card application number will be generated and displayed. 
***Job Card Download Process:***
- Visit the official website and click on the "Download Job Card"
- Enter your Job Card Number and Aadhaar Number. 
- Complete the captcha verification.
- Click the "Submit" to download the card.
***After Generated the Job Card Raise a Request for "Demand Work":***
- Click on the "Demand Work"
- Fill Job Card Number and Aadhaar Card Number.
- Fill in the Demand Days (specify the number of days for which you are demanding work).
- Complete the captcha verification. 
- Submit the request.
- Work allocation details will be sent via SMS to the registered mobile number and will also be available on the scheme’s portal.
Tags: Employment, Unskilled Workers, Urban Areas

Scheme Name: Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana: Assistance to Special Entrepreneurship Degree Approach Training with 360 Promoters/ with Mentoring Support and Sustenance Allowance for Entrepreneurs
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) community.
1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme "Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Udyog Uday Yojana" aims to support SC/ST entrepreneurs and strengthen MSMEs, making them globally competitive.
> **Special Entrepreneurship Training:**
1. 100% coverage of training fees, up to ₹10,000/- per month per person.
1. Training duration between 6 months to 1 year.
1. Covers business management, finance, marketing, logistics, soft skills, and best practices.
> **Mentorship Support:**
1. Entrepreneurs receive expert guidance from industrial mentors.
1. 100% coverage of mentorship fees, up to ₹5,000/- per month per person for 3 months.
1. Helps in understanding business operations, strategies, and management.
> **Sustenance Allowance:**
1. ₹5,000/- per month for the duration of training to support personal expenses.
Application Process:
**Step-1:** Fill out the [prescribed application form](https://ced.gujarat.gov.in/assets/downloads/360_Degree_Detail_application.pdf) with relevant details. **Step-2:** Attach the required documents. **Step-3:** Submit the application to The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development(CED).
&gt; **Application to be Submitted to the below Address:** Director, The Center for Entrepreneurship Development, Block No.1, 9th Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Sector 11, Gandhinagar - 382 017 &lt;br&gt; &amp;amp;amp;gt; **For Further information/queries:** Phone: 079-23247366, 23243847, 23240253 Fax: 079-23256679 E-mail: dir-ced@gujarat.gov.in Web site: [www.ced.gujarat.gov.in](http://www.ced.gujarat.gov.in/)
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, Entrepreneurship Training, MSMEs, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Start Up

Scheme Name: Goa Mediclaim Scheme
Eligibility Criteria:
- The applicant should be a permanent resident of Goa.
- The applicant should be residing in Goa for 15 years, figuring in the voters' list and holding a permanent ration card. 
- The income of the applicant should be less than ₹1,50,000/- per annum. However, retired state government employees are eligible irrespective of their income.
- The applicant should require a facility that is not available in a Government Hospital of Goa (including Goa Medical College, Bambolim and District Hospitals). However, for NICU, Ventilatory Support and Kidney Dialysis, the patient may opt for any empanelled hospital even if the facilities are available in a Government hospital.
- The applicant should be suffering from a sickness/ailment that requires one of the following treatments - Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis (CAPD), Dialysis, Plastic Surgery, Intensive Care Unit (ICU), Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU), Trauma Care, Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG) / Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA) (Angiography & Angioplasty), Open Heart Surgery (Valve Replacement, Mitral Valve Replacement (MVR), Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD), Atrial Septal Defect (ASD)), Kidney Transplantation, Neuro Surgery, Radiotherapy / Chemotherapy (Cancer), Cochlear Implant, Spastic Child, Cerebral Palsy, Skeletal Deformities, and Bone Marrow Transplant.
Description & Benefits:
“Goa Mediclaim Scheme” provides financial assistance to avail super-speciality treatments that are not available in the Government Hospitals of Goa, such as dialysis, plastic surgery, ICU care, angiography and angioplasty, open-heart surgery, kidney transplantation, neurosurgery, etc.
**The Nature of Sickness along with its Permitted Ceiling Limit for the Super-Specialty Treatment is given below -** 
- Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis (CAPD) Treatment: ₹15,000/- per month
- Dialysis: ₹15,600/- per month @ ₹1,300/- per dialysis for 12 dialysis
- Plastic Surgery: ₹1,50,000/-
- Intensive Care Unit (ICU), Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU), Trauma Care: ₹1,50,000/-
- Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG) / Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA) (Angiography & Angioplasty) : ₹1,50,000/-
- Open Heart Surgery (Valve replacement, Mitral Valve Replacement (MVR), Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD), Atrial Septal Defect (ASD): ₹3,00,000/-
- Kidney Transplantation: ₹3,00,000/-
- Neuro Surgery: ₹3,00,000/-
- Radiotherapy / Chemotherapy (Cancer): ₹5,00,000/-
- Cochlear Implant: ₹1,50,000/-
- Spastic Child, Cerebral Palsy, Skeletal Deformities: ₹1,50,000/-
- Bone Marrow Transplant: ₹8,00,000/-
_*The list of the hospitals recognized under this scheme, and the medical treatment covered under each hospital are provided in the scheme guidelines._
_*Either the Permitted Ceiling Limit Treatment or the Actual Expense of Treatment, whichever is the least will be considered._
Application Process:
The interested individual should apply to the **Director of Health Services, Panaji, Goa** in the [prescribed form](https://www.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Goa-Mediclaim-Scheme.pdf), along with the required documents. 
**Officer to Be Contacted:** Joint Director of Accounts (Health), Directorate of Health Services, Campal, Panaji, Goa; Ph. No. 0832-2225646, Ext-214. 
**Detail of Office Where the Application to Be Submitted:** Mediclaim Cell, S-37, Second Floor, Directorate of Health Services, Campal, Panaji-Goa.
Tags: Health, Hospital, Medicine, Mediclaim, Patient

Scheme Name: Antheyesthi Anudan Yojana
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a voluntary organization recognized by the state government.
   1. The voluntary organization should be registered under the Societies Act.
   1. The voluntary organization should be actively working in the welfare of destitute and helpless individuals or have prior experience in this field.
   1. The financial condition of the voluntary organization should be strong.
   1. The voluntary organization should not have been penalized or blacklisted in the past for any reason.
   1. The deceased should be identified as unclaimed or destitute, with no known family or relatives to perform the last rites.
   1. The death should have occurred within the jurisdiction of Rajasthan.
   1. The organization should agree to conduct the last rites of the unclaimed or destitute deceased immediately at its own level with full legal procedure and to receive reimbursement of the amount fixed under this scheme from the State Government.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,000/- to NGOs for performing the last rites of any unclaimed or destitute person of any age/caste/class, who has died either naturally or due to an accident within Rajasthan or outside the state, provided that the cremation is conducted in Rajasthan.
A one-time grant of ₹5,000 is provided to voluntary organizations for conducting the last rites of unclaimed or destitute deceased individuals.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant downloaded the application form [(Appendix-A)](https://sje.rajasthan.gov.in/Schemes/Antheyesthi_Scheme.pdf) from the official website. 
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Social Justice and Empowerment Department or the designated local office responsible for the scheme. 
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).
**Reporting the Death:** 
Upon discovering an unclaimed or destitute deceased individual, the voluntary organization should immediately report the death to the local authorities or police station.
**Verification:**
The local police or competent authority will verify the status of the deceased as unclaimed or destitute.
Tags: Deceased, Destitute, Financial Assistance, Funeral, Last Rites

Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME): Assistance for Raising Capital through SME Exchange
Eligibility Criteria:
- The enterprise must be registered as an MSME at the time of listing.
  - The MSME must have successfully raised equity capital through the SME Exchange.
  - The enterprise must apply within one year of the listing date.
  - The fundraising should be as per the approved scheme by the SME Exchange.
Description & Benefits:
The "Scheme for Assistance to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME)" launched by the Industries and Mines Department aims to position Gujarat as a global business hub, promoting sustainable manufacturing, MSME growth, and export competitiveness.
  - **Financial Assistance:** MSMEs can avail of 25% reimbursement of expenses incurred in raising funds through the SME Exchange, up to ₹5,00,000/-.  - **Equity Capital Support:** Helps MSMEs raise equity capital for business expansion and growth.  - **Encouragement for Listing:** Incentivizes MSMEs to get listed on the SME Exchange, improving visibility and credibility.
Application Process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step-1:** Visit the [Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP)](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/) portal. Click on "New Investor Registration" to access the registration form. **Step-2:** Fill in the Registration Form. Click on "Submit". **Step-3:** Verify the E-mail ID using the link sent on your registered E-mail ID. **Step-4:** After verification, you will be registered successfully.
> **Post-Registration Process:** **Step-1:** Visit the [Investor Facilitation Portal (IFP)](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/) portal. Click on "Login". **Step-2:** Enter the email address and password you used during registration. **Step-3:** Click the "Login" button to access your account. **Step-4:** Now fill in the required details and mandatory documents about your business to complete the application process.
> **Helpdesk:** [**Contact Here.**](https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/IFP-pages/contact.jsp?pagedisp=static)
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Start Up

Scheme Name: e-Adhigam Scheme - Free Tablet
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant must be a student of a government school in Haryana.
1. The applicant must be studying in Class 8, 9, 10, 11, or 12.
1. The applicant must be part of the phased distribution plan as per the Haryana Government’s rollout strategy.
1. Class 11 students will receive tablets only after clearing the Class 10 board exams.
Description & Benefits:
This scheme was launched with objective of promoting digital education & providing online learning to children from poor & needy families, proving to be a boon for them. Under this scheme, free tablets are provided to students, enabling access to state-of-the-art software & learning materials.
**Tangible Benefits:**
1. **Free Android Tablets** – Provided to students in Classes 8 to 12.1. **Pre-loaded Content** – Tablets come with pre-loaded educational content, personalized adaptive learning (PAL) platform, and study materials.1. **2GB Free Data Per Month** – Enables students to access online study resources.
> **Mode of Disbursement:**
- Tablets are distributed in government schools under the Haryana Free Tablet Scheme.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:**
- Tablets are distributed once to eligible students.
- Free 2GB of data is provided every month.
> **Validity of Benefits:**
- The tablets remain the property of the Haryana Government.
- Students must return the tablets after completing Class 12.
Application Process:
- Students should check with their school authorities for further details on tablet distribution timelines and eligibility confirmation.
**Note:** The scheme appears to be implemented directly through government schools without requiring students to apply individually .
Tags: Digital Learning, Education, Free Tablet, Smart Tablets, Student

Scheme Name: Paternity Benefit Scheme (BBOCWWB)
Eligibility Criteria:
- The applicant should be a worker.
- The applicant should be a male.
- The applicant should be engaged in building or construction work.
- The applicant should be registered with the "Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board".
- The applicant's membership with the Welfare Board must be active at the time of application.
- The applicant should have at least one year of membership with the Board.
- The wife of the applicant should not be registered with the Board.
- The benefits will be applicable for the first two childbirths.
Description & Benefits:
The "Paternity Benefit Scheme" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board, Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides ₹6,000/- per childbirth to the male workers, provided that their wife is not registered with the Board.
Financial Assistance of ₹6,000/- per childbirth for upto two childbirths.
Application Process:
&gt; **Registration**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/LabourReg.aspx) of the Bihar Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and click &amp;quot;[Apply for New Registration](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/AddLabourRegistrationWeb.aspx)&amp;quot;.
**Step 4:** On the next page, provide your details including your Aadhaar Number. Then click &amp;quot;Authenticate&amp;quot;.
**Step 5:** An online form will appear. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields. The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory.
**Step 6:** Click &amp;quot;Submit&amp;quot;. Proceed to pay the application fee online.
**Step 7:****** Upon successful payment, you will receive your construction worker registration number.
&gt; **Application**
**Step 1:****** Visit the [Official Website ](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/SchemeApply.aspx)of the Bihar Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
**Step 2:** Click on &amp;quot;[Scheme Application](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/SchemeApply.aspx)&amp;quot; and select &amp;quot;[Apply for Scheme](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/SchemeTaggingWeb.aspx)&amp;quot;.
**Step 3:****** Enter your registration number and click &amp;quot;Show&amp;quot; to view your details.
**Step 4:****** Select the scheme you intend to apply for, enter all mandatory information and upload the necessary documents in the specified format and size.
**Step 6:****** Click on &amp;quot;Submit Application&amp;quot; to complete the process.
&gt; **Application Tracking**
Applicants can track their application status online on the [official website ](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/ApplicationStatus.aspx)of the Board by providing their registration number.
Tags: Building, Construction, Father, Financial Assistance, Labour, Worker

Scheme Name: Consolidated Stipend Scheme for Scheduled Caste Students Pursuing Higher Education
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
1. The applicant should be a domicile of Haryana.
1. The applicant should be studying in a government college in Haryana.
1. The applicant should have passed the previous academic year examination.
1. The applicant should maintain at least 60% attendance to receive the stipend.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Haryana, on 1st July, 2008, with the aim of attracting SC students towards higher education. Under this scheme, SC students studying in Govt. Colleges will receive a stipend of ₹1,000 per month. 
1. **Stipend Amount:** Eligible SC students receive ₹1,000/- per month.1. **Hostel Stipend:** Additional ₹500/- per month for 12 months for students availing hostel facilities.
**Mode of Disbursement:**
1. The stipend is disbursed bi-monthly in September, November, January, and March.
1. The amount for January to June is disbursed in March due to the financial year closure.
1. Payments are transferred directly to students' Aadhaar-seeded bank accounts through the Public Financial Management System (PFMS).
**Frequency of Disbursement:**
1. **Stipend:** Four bimonthly instalments per year.1. **Hostel Stipend:** Two half-yearly instalments (July-December, January-June).
**Expected Time of Disbursement:**
1. **Stipend:** First week of the disbursement month (September, November, January, March).1. **Hostel Stipend:** November and January.
Application Process:
**Registration**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the menu ribbon, click "Student > [Student Registration](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/StudentRegistration)".
**Step 3:** On the next page, provide your Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID) and click "Search".
*Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) is mandatory for availing of any Scholarship benefit. Students are advised to ensure their all particulars such as Name, DOB, Aadhar No. etc are fully updated in PPP before applying for any scholarship scheme.
**Step 4:** A List of the members of your family will be displayed. Select the checkbox against your name and click "Generate OTP". Enter the OTP received on your registered Mobile Number and click on "Verify OTP".
**Step 5:** After OTP verification, you will be taken to the registration page. In the registration form, all the mandatory fields get auto-filled. You only need to cross-check the information.
**Step 6:** Select your Department and College. Create a Password and click "Register".
**Application**
**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/StudentRegistration) of the "Centralized Scholarship Portal" of the Department of Higher Education, Haryana.
**Step 2:** In the right corner of the menu ribbon, click "[User Login](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/UserLogin)". Use the username and password created during your registration to log in.
**Step 3:** Navigate to the online form of the scheme you intend to apply for. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections.
**Step 4:** Click "Apply" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message.
**Track Application:**
Students can track their application status on the [Har-Chhatravratti Portal](https://harchhatravratti.highereduhry.ac.in/TrackApplication) using their Aadhaar Number.
Tags: Consolidated, Higher Education, Scheduled Caste, Stipend, Student

50% of the pension amount or ₹100/-, whichever is higher.

Scheme Name: Cash Prizes Scheme (BBOCWWB)
Eligibility Criteria:
**For the Worker**
- The worker should be engaged in building or construction work.
- The worker should be registered with the "Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board".
- The worker's membership with the Welfare Board must be active at the time of application.
- The worker should have at least one year of membership with the Board.
- A maximum of two children of the registered construction worker will be eligible for the benefit.
**For the Child**
- The child should have passed the 10th or 12th examination conducted by a board in Bihar.
- The child should have scored 60% or above in the examination.
Description & Benefits:
"Cash Prizes Scheme" was launched by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Students securing 60% or more in the 10th and 12th exams receive cash prizes of up to ₹25,000/- per year. Upto two children of a registered construction worker are eligible.
- On securing 80% or more in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹25,000/- per year.
- On securing 70% to 79.99% in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹15,000/- per year.
- On securing 60% to 69.99% in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹10,000/- per year.

**Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/LabourReg.aspx) of the Bihar Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and click &quot;[Apply for New Registration](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/AddLabourRegistrationWeb.aspx)&quot;.
**Step 4:** On the next page, provide your details including your Aadhaar Number. Then click &quot;Authenticate&quot;.
**Step 5:** An online form will appear. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields. The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory.
**Step 6:** Click &quot;Submit&quot;. Proceed to pay the application fee online.
**Step 7:****** Upon successful payment, you will receive your construction worker registration number.
> **Application**
**Step 1:****** Visit the [Official Website ](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/SchemeApply.aspx)of the Bihar Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
**Step 2:** Click on &quot;[Scheme Application](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Website/SchemeApply.aspx)&quot; and select &quot;[Apply for Scheme](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/SchemeTaggingWeb.aspx)&quot;.
**Step 3:****** Enter your registration number and click &quot;Show&quot; to view your details.
**Step 4:****** Select the scheme you intend to apply for, enter all mandatory information and upload the necessary documents in the specified format and size.
**Step 6:****** Click on &quot;Submit Application&quot; to complete the process.
> **Application Tracking**
Applicants can track their application status online on the [official website ](https://bocw.bihar.gov.in/Registration/ApplicationStatus.aspx)of the Board by providing their registration number.

Scheme Name: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Financial Assistance for Studying Bisexual Children
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to transgender community. 
1. The applicant should be studying in class 6th or higher class.
1. The applicant should be residing away from their home for study purpose.
1. The gross annual income of applicant should be up to ₹8.00 lakh.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme objective is to provide financial assistance of ₹6,000 per month for up to 12 months to transgender students from Class 6 and above for accommodation and daily needs if they live away from their homes for education.
- Financial assistance of ₹6,000/- per month for up to 12 months to support transgender students living away from their homes for education.
**NOTE:**
- Assistance is provided directly to the student's bank account.
- Students must submit a rental receipt each month to continue receiving assistance.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the concerned Educational Institution and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in application.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Educational Institution.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Educational Institution to whom the application has been submitted.
**Step 5:** The concerned institution will forward the application form along with the recommendation to the district office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Department.
**Step 6:** The District Office, Social Justice and Empowerment Department will examine the received application form within a month and issue offline approval and transfer the amount to the applicant&#39;s bank account every month.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Pre-Matric, Student, Transgender

Scheme Name: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Pre Matric Scholarship for Studying Transgender
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to the transgender community.
1. The applicant should be studying at the primary to pre-matric level.
1. The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized school within Rajasthan.
1. The applicant’s family annual income should not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme aims to support transgender students by providing scholarships to encourage their education and social upliftment. Under this scheme, transgender students receive a monthly scholarship of ₹225/- per month to cover educational expenses from primary to pre-matric levels.
***Pre-Matric Scholarship:***
- ₹225/- per month per student for 10 months.
**NOTE:** The scholarship amount is directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account.
Application Process:
***Application Submission:***
- The applicant/parents/guardians must fill out the scholarship application form and attach the required documents. 
- Submit the complete application form to their school principal.
***Institutional Verification:***
- The school principal verifies the application and forwards it to the Social Justice and Empowerment Department's district office.
***Approval Process:***
- The district office verifies the documents and approves/rejects the application within one month.
***Disbursement:***
- Upon approval, the scholarship amount is transferred to the applicant's bank account.
Tags: Pre-Matric, Scholarship, Student, Transgender

Scheme Name: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Post Matric Scholarship for Studying Transgender
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to the transgender community.
1. The applicant should be studying at the post-matric level.
1. The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized school/college in Rajasthan.
1. The applicant’s family annual income should not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme aims to support transgender students pursuing post-matric education. Under this scheme, transgender students receive a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000/- to cover educational expenses for their post-matric studies.
***Post-Matric Scholarship:***
- Scholarship @ ₹1,000/- per month per student for 10 months.
**NOTE:** The scholarship amount is directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account.
Application Process:
***Application Submission:***
- The applicant/parents/guardians must fill out the scholarship application form and attach the required documents. 
- Submit the complete application form to their school principal/institution.
***Institutional Verification:***
- The school principal/institution verifies the application and forwards it to the Social Justice and Empowerment Department's district office.
***Approval Process:***
- The district office verifies the documents and approves/rejects the application within one month.
***Disbursement:***
- Upon approval, the scholarship amount is transferred to the applicant's bank account.
Tags: Post-matric, Scholarship, Student, Transgender

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for Private Self-Financed Technical Institutions
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The institution should be a registered private self-financed engineering or polytechnic institute in Jharkhand.
1. The institution should have been operational for at least 5 years with audited financial statements.
1. The institution should have AICTE approval and affiliation with the State Board of Technical Education, Jharkhand or a recognized university.
1. The institution must comply with AICTE norms, including having qualified faculty and proper infrastructure.
Description & Benefits:
The "Financial Assistance for Private Self-Financed Technical Institutions" scheme by the Higher, Technical Education & Skill Development Department, Government of Jharkhand, provides grants to private engineering and polytechnic institutions for infrastructure enhancement and quality education. 1. Grant of up to ₹2,00,00,000/- for new private engineering institutions. 1. Grant of up to ₹1,00,00,000/- for new private polytechnic institutions for infrastructure development. 1. Grant of up to ₹6,00,00,000/- for existing engineering institutions. 1. Grant of up to ₹3,00,00,000/- for existing polytechnic institutions for upgrading facilities.
**NOTE:** 1. Assistance is provided in three equal installments. 1. Accreditation-linked funding: the second installment requires two NBA-accredited courses, and the third installment requires four NBA-accredited courses. 1. At least 60% of seats are reserved for local students of Jharkhand.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Higher, Technical Education & Skill Development Department and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Higher, Technical Education & Skill Development Department.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
Tags: Financial Assistance, Infrastructure, Institutions, Technical

Scheme Name: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Training Programme for Transgender
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should be a transgender person.
   1. The gross annual income of applicant should not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.
   1. A maximum of two training courses can be availed under this scheme.
**Note 1:** The applicant must meet the minimum age and educational qualification criteria set by the respective training institution.
**Note 2:** The State Government will reimburse the prescribed fees and other expenses to the training providing institute for the concerned programme.
**Note 3:** The fees will be made available directly to the concerned training institute after the transgender person is admitted to the respective programme.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme aims to support the socio-economic development of transgender individuals by providing financial assistance, skill training, and employment opportunities.
***Skill Development:***

  - Vocational/technical training will be provided to transgender persons through the Rajasthan Skill and Livelihood Development Corporation (RSLDC), Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Limited (RKCL), Jan Shikshan Sansthan, Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs), or training providers recognized by the State or Central Government.

***Financial Assistance:***

- After receiving skill development training, each trainee will be given a lump sum amount of ₹5,000/- per month for one course (for maximum three months and for two courses).
- Transgender persons can avail maximum 2 training programmes only.

***Training Fee Coverage:********* 

- The state government reimburses the training fee directly to the training institutions.

***Employment Support and Certificate:***

- Upon completion of training, the beneficiary will receive a certificate and employment assistance.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Social Justice and Empowerment Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Social Justice and Empowerment Office. 
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Social Justice and Empowerment Office to whom the application has been submitted.
**Verification Process:**

  - District Officer, Social Justice and Empowerment Department will scrutinize the received application within a maximum period of 1 month and issue administrative and financial approval and make the payment.
  - The training fee will be reimbursed directly to the training institute upon successful enrollment.

**Note:** The transgender person shall apply for training through the identified vocational / technical training programmes conducted through the concerned institute / training providers.
Tags: Employment Opportunity, Financial Assistance, Skill Development, Skill Training, Technical Training, Transgender, Vocational Training

Scheme Name: Gujarat Textile Policy: Assistance for Quality Certification
Eligibility Criteria:
- The certification must be from a recognized national or international body.
- The unit should have incurred actual expenses for certification and testing equipment.
- The application must be submitted within one year from the date of certification.
Description & Benefits:
The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State.

  - **Financial Support:** Reimbursement of 50% of certification fees and 50% of testing equipment/machinery costs up to ₹10,00,000/-.  - **Eligible Certifications:** Includes BIS, ISI, WHO-GMP, Hallmark, and other recognized National/International certifications.  - **Covered Expenses:**



      1. Fees charged by certification agencies (excluding travel, hotel &amp;amp; surveillance charges).
      1. Cost of required testing equipment/machinery.
      1. Calibration charges for testing equipment.
Application Process:
> **Application for Registration:**

**Step 1:** The application has to be made to the Industries Commissioner in the [prescribed format](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/documents/commondoc/2025/GTP%202024%20Registration%20Form.pdf) along with the following documents within one year from loan disbursement, production start, or policy operative date (whichever is later).
**Step 2:** On receipt of the application and after the scrutiny and verification of relevant documents as per the procedure prescribed, registration certificate will be issued by the Industrial Commissioner.
> **Application for Provisional/Final Eligibility Certificate:**

**Application for Industrial Unit:**

  - **MSME Units having GFCI up to INR 10 Crore:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit shall submit an application to the General Manager, District Industries Center.  - **MSME Units having GFCI above INR 10 Crore and up to 50 Crore:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit  shall submit an application to MSME Commissioner for Provisional Eligibility Certificate within 1 year from DoCP or within one year from the date of issuance of this GR, whichever is later.  - **Other than MSME Units:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit, having registration shall submit an application for Provisional Eligibility Certificate to the Industries Commissioner within 1 year from DoCP or within 1 year from the date of issuance of the registration certificate, whichever is later.
**Contact Us:**
> [Industries Commissionerate](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/ic-contact.aspx)

> [District Industries Center](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/dic-contact.aspx)
Tags: Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Textile Industry

Scheme Name: Transgender Utthan Kosh – Identity Card for Transgender
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant must belong to the transgender community.
Description & Benefits:
This scheme aims to identify transgender persons and issuing identity cards to them. This certificate/identity card will be valid for all government purposes, including obtaining a ration card, Aadhaar card, birth certificate, etc.

- Issuance of identification cards to recognized transgender individuals.
- Transgender person applies for an ID card themselves, the payment will be made to their account upon presentation of the ID card.
- This certificate/identity card will be valid for all government purposes like ration card, Aadhaar card and birth certificate etc.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District-Level Committee at the Collector’s Office/Social Justice and Empowerment Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District-Level Committee at the Collector’s Office/Social Justice and Empowerment Office. 
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District-Level Committee at the Collector’s Office/Social Justice and Empowerment Office to whom the application has been submitted.
**Note 1:** For making identity cards, NGOs can make ID cards through online portal, honorarium for which will be paid to NGO per ID card.
**Note 2:** If the transgender person himself gets the ID card made through the online portal, then on presenting his own card, payment can be made into the account.
Tags: Citizen Empowerment, Identity Card, Transgender

Scheme Name: Gujarat Textile Policy: Capital Subsidy
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The industrial unit must have availed a Term Loan for the project.
   1. The unit must commence commercial production before applying for subsidy disbursement.
   1. The unit must apply within one year from the Date of Commercial Production (DoCP).
   1. The total subsidy received (State + Central) should not exceed the total term loan amount disbursed.

&lt;br&gt;

&gt; **Eligible Activities:**

**Activity 1:**

  - Garments, Apparel &amp;amp; Made-ups, Technical Textiles Activity (including Composite Unit)

**Activity 2:**

  - Weaving (with or without preparatory), Knitting, Dyeing &amp;amp; Processing, Texturising, Twisting, Embroidery and MMF Spinning to manufacture yarn from Polyester Staple Fiber (PSF) / Viscose Staple Fiber (VSF) (excluding Spinning activity of Cotton and Synthetic Filament Yarn).
Description & Benefits:
The "Gujarat Textile Policy" introduced by the Industries and Mines Department aims to create a vibrant Textile Sector ecosystem and generate enormous employment opportunities in the State. **Financial Assistance:** **Category of Taluka****Activity 1****Activity 2**[Category 1](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/documents/commondoc/2020/I-Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98_06112020.pdf) &amp;amp; PM MITRA Park35% of eFCI, Maximum ₹100,00,00,000/-20% of eFCI, Maximum ₹50,00,00,000/-[Category 2](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/documents/commondoc/2020/I-Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98_06112020.pdf)30% of eFCI, Maximum ₹100,00,00,000/-18% of eFCI, Maximum ₹50,00,00,000/-[Category 3](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/documents/commondoc/2020/I-Branch_2297_02_Nov_2020_98_06112020.pdf)20% of eFCI, Maximum ₹50,00,00,000/-10% of eFCI, Maximum ₹40,00,00,000/-
**Note:** - **Eligible Fixed Capital Investment:** Eligible Fixed Capital Investment (eFCI) means the following components of investment made during the Eligible Investment Period.- If Industrial Unit is availing Capital Subsidy under any scheme of Central Government, then total quantum of Capital Subsidy from State and Central Government, in any case shall not exceed the total term loan amount disbursed.
Application Process:
> **Application for Registration:**

**Step 1:** The application has to be made to the Industries Commissioner in the [prescribed format](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/documents/commondoc/2025/GTP%202024%20Registration%20Form.pdf) along with the following documents within one year from loan disbursement, production start, or policy operative date (whichever is later).
**Step 2:** On receipt of the application and after the scrutiny and verification of relevant documents as per the procedure prescribed, registration certificate will be issued by the Industrial Commissioner.
> **Application for Provisional/Final Eligibility Certificate****:- Application for Industrial Unit**


  - **MSME Units having GFCI up to INR 10 Crore:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit shall submit an application to the General Manager, District Industries Center.  - **MSME Units having GFCI above INR 10 Crore and up to 50 Crore:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit  shall submit an application to MSME Commissioner for Provisional Eligibility Certificate within 1 year from DoCP or within one year from the date of issuance of this GR, whichever is later.  - **Other than MSME Units:** After DoCP, the Industrial Unit, having registration shall submit an application for Provisional Eligibility Certificate to the Industries Commissioner within 1 year from DoCP or within 1 year from the date of issuance of the registration certificate, whichever is later.
**Contact Us:**
> [Industries Commissionerate](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/ic-contact.aspx)

> [District Industries Center](https://ic.gujarat.gov.in/dic-contact.aspx)

Scheme Name: Aastha Yojana
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The two or more members should be specially abled from the same family.
1. The applicant must have a disability of 40%.
1. The annual family income should not exceed ₹1,20,000/-.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme aims to provide BPL-equivalent benefits to families with two or more specially-abled members. Under this scheme, eligible families receive free medical treatment, ration supplies, and other welfare benefits. 

- Aastha cardholder families receive benefits similar to BPL families, including free medical treatment and ration supplies.

**Note:** Aastha cardholders are entitled to benefits from all BPL-related schemes run by different state government departments.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit office of the District Social Justice &amp; Empowerment Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Social Justice &amp; Empowerment Office.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Social Justice &amp; Empowerment Office to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).
Tags: Astha Card, Medical Treatment, Persons With Disabilities, PwD, Ration, Welfare Benefits

Scheme Name: Grant of Financial Incentives for Hotels, Resorts, and Tourism Projects
Eligibility Criteria:
- The scheme applies to star-classified hotels/resorts, heritage hotels, and other tourism projects completed and commissioned from 2005 onwards.
- The project must be in continuous commercial operation.
- The applicant must have financially invested in the property and developed the project.
- The hotel/resort must have star classification or heritage classification approved by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India.
- The project must not have availed any other capital subsidy/incentive from the Government of Puducherry or the Government of India.
- The project must continue in the same name and style for eight years from the date of release of the incentive.
Description & Benefits:
The scheme aims to promote tourism infrastructure by providing financial incentives to hotels, resorts, heritage hotels, and other tourism projects. The scheme offers capital grants and subsidies to eligible applicants who have invested in and developed tourism-related projects.
> **Capital Grant for Star-Classified Hotels**


- ₹2,00,000/- per room, subject to a maximum of ₹30,00,000/- for one-star hotels.
- ₹3,00,000/- per room, subject to a maximum of ₹75,00,000/- for two-star hotels.
- ₹3,00,000/- per room, subject to a maximum of ₹1,00,00,000/- for three-star hotels.

> **Capital Grant for Heritage Hotels**


- ₹3,00,000/- per room, subject to a maximum of ₹75,00,000/-.
- The building must be listed in the current list of heritage buildings in Puducherry and conform to architectural and conservation guidelines.

> **Capital Subsidy for Higher-Category Projects**


- 25% of the capital investment, subject to a maximum of ₹1,00,00,000/- for hotels/resorts with more than three-star classification and other tourism projects like water theme parks, amusement parks, yacht marinas, family entertainment centers, convention centers, and cruise tourism.

> **Service Apartments**


- ₹1,00,000/- per apartment, subject to a maximum of ₹6,00,000/- for 'Silver' category.
- ₹2,00,000/- per apartment, subject to a maximum of ₹12,00,000/- for 'Gold' or higher category.

> **Mode of Disbursement**

The incentive is directly released to the authorized/approved financial institutions if a loan was taken for the project. If no loan was taken, the amount is released directly to the applicant.
> **Expected Time of Disbursement**

Priority for disbursement is based on the date of star classification/heritage classification or the date of commercial operation for other tourism projects.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** Take a print of the [prescribed format](https://styandptg.py.gov.in/2010/February/EXTRAORDINARYPART-II/1/005-PART-II%20No.%20005%20dated%201-2-2010.pdf) of the application form. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form and the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Department of Industrial Development (Tourism), Government of Puducherry. **Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
> **Post-Application Processes** **Step 1:** A committee consisting of the Secretary to Government (Tourism), Managing Director (PTDC), Member-Secretary (PPA), Commissioner (Puducherry Municipality), Representative of Finance Department, Architect (Representative of INTACH), and Director of Tourism will review the application to determine eligibility and the quantum of incentive. **Step 2:** If approved, the incentive will be released directly to the authorized financial institution (if a loan was taken) or to the applicant (if no loan was taken). The incentive may be released in installments. _*The applicant must provide an undertaking on ₹50/- stamp paper, stating that the project will continue in the same name and style for eight years from the date of release of the incentive._
Tags: Heritage, Hotel, Incentive, Resort, Tourism

Scheme Name: Varishtha Bunkar Samman Yojana
Eligibility Criteria:
- The applicant should be an active weaver member of the primary weaver cooperative society.
- The applicant should be affiliated with the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Union, Raipur.
- The applicant should be 60 years or older in age.
- One weaver from each district of the state who has produced the maximum cloth in that district.
- The weaver should not be a defaulter with the society.
Description & Benefits:
"Varishtha Bunkar Samman Yojana" aims to encourage senior weavers in the handloom sector. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹11,000/- to active weaver members who are 60 years or older and have produced the maximum cloth in their district.
Financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take print of the [prescribed format](https://www.cgapexhandloom.org.in/portal/%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%B7%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A0-%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%B0-%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A8-%E0%A4%AF%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%9C%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE) of the application form.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents within the prescribed period (if any), to the Primary Weaver Cooperative Society.
**Step 4:** The Primary Weaver Cooperative Society will verify the details, complete their formalities, add their remarks, and forward the application to the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Union through the District Handloom Office.
**Step 5:** A selection committee verifies the application and determines if the applicant is suitable for the honor.
**Step 6:** The Deputy/Assistant Director of the District Handloom Office makes a recommendation for the weaver to be honored in the Union's Best Weaver Honor Ceremony. The final selection is made by the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur.
Tags: Financial Assistance, Handloom, Senior Citizen, Textile, Weaver

Scheme Name: Scheme for Awards to MSMES
Eligibility Criteria:
1. Enterprises shall be in continuous production for the previous three years.
   1. Enterprises shall have valid statutory clearances and licenses as may be applicable.

<br>

**Note****:** MSME/Start-up will be entitled for only one award in each category during operative period of the scheme in each category.
Description & Benefits:
The Government of Gujarat has introduced the "Scheme for Awards to MSMEs" under the Industrial Policy 2020. This scheme aims to recognize and reward Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) for their outstanding achievements in production, quality improvement, innovation, and entrepreneurship.
> **1. Separate awards to be given for Micro, Small and Medium category:**

**Category:** Three awards to be awarded in each category-

  - Growth in production and profit
  - Quality and environment improvement measures
  - Innovation in technology for new product or process development

**Award Money:** Amount of ₹2,00,000/-, Trophy and Appreciation letter to each winner.
<br>

> **2. Awards to Best MSEs Entrepreneur in the following category one to each:**

**Category:** One award to be awarded in each category-

  - Woman Entrepreneur
  - Young Entrepreneurs (first generation Entrepreneurs below 35 year age)
  - SC Entrepreneur
  - ST Entrepreneur

**Award Money:** Amount of ₹2,00,000/-, Trophy and Appreciation letter to each winner..
<br>

> **3. Awards for Commercially Successful Best MSME Start-up:**

**Award Money:** Amount of ₹2,00,000/-, Trophy and Appreciation letter to each winner.
Application Process:
**Step-1:** MSME Commissionerate invites applications through advertisements in local newspapers. **Step-2:** Enterprises must submit the prescribed application form along with the required documents. **Step-3:** A working committee reviews applications and ranks them. **Step-4:** The State Level Empowered Committee (SLEC) selects the awardees. **Step-5:** MSME Commissionerate publishes the final list of selected enterprises.
> **Contact Us:** Startup Gujarat Cell Office of Industries Commissionerate Block No: 1, 3rd Floor, Udhyog Bhavan, Sector: 11, Gandhi Nagar - 382010 Gujarat, INDIA. 079-23252588 / 1800-233-0616 icstup@gujarat.gov.in
Tags: Award, Business, Entrepreneurship, MSMEs, Start Up

Scheme Name: Bunkar Parivar Ke Pratibhavan Chatra-Chatraon Ko Protsahan Puraskar Yojana
Eligibility Criteria:
- The student's parent must be a regular member of a primary weaver cooperative society affiliated with the "Chhattisgarh Rajya Hathkargha Vikas Evam Vipanan Sahkari Sangh Maryadit, Raipur".
- The student must be a resident of Chhattisgarh state.
- The student's parent must be a regular member of the weaver cooperative society.
- The student must have passed 10th or 12th board examination with 60% or above marks.
- The parent's income from weaving should be more than 50% of their total income.

_*Weaver family refers to husband, wife, and their children._
Description & Benefits:
"Bunkar Parivar Ke Pratibhavan Chatra-Chatraon Ko Protsahan Puraskar Yojana" aims to motivate and encourage children of weaver families for higher education. Monetary rewards are given to talented students who score well in 10th/12th board exams.
The scheme provides monetary incentives to children of weavers based on their performance in 10th and 12th board examinations.
**For 10th Pass Students**

- 60% and above marks: ₹4,100/-
- 70% and above marks: ₹8,100/-
- 80% and above marks: ₹12,100/-
- 90% and above marks: ₹16,100/-

**For 12th Pass Students**

- 60% and above marks: ₹6,100/-
- 70% and above marks: ₹10,100/-
- 80% and above marks: ₹14,100/-
- 90% and above marks: ₹20,100/-
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take print of the [prescribed format](https://www.cgapexhandloom.org.in/portal/%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%B0-%E0%A4%AA%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0-%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%87-%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%AD%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A8-%E0%A4%9B%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0-%E0%A4%9B%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%93%E0%A4%82-%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B-%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%A8-%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%B8%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0-%E0%A4%AF%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%9C%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE) of the application form given in the scheme guidelines. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Primary Weaver Cooperative Society. **Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
> **Post-Application Processes** **Step 1:** The society will verify that the applicant's parent is a regular member and add necessary details such as membership number and the type of textile production they are involved in. The President/Manager of the society will sign and stamp the form after verification. **Step 2:** The Primary Weaver Cooperative Society forwards the application to the concerned District Handloom Office. The Deputy/Assistant Director of the District Handloom Office records the date of receipt. **Step 3:** A selection committee reviews all applications, verifies the details and marks obtained by the applicants, and recommends eligible candidates for the award. The District Handloom Office prepares a consolidated list of all eligible students. The list along with recommendations is sent to the Managing Director, Chhattisgarh Rajya Hathkargha Vikas Evam Vipanan Sahkari Sangh Maryadit, Raipur.
> **Contact Details of the Implementing Agency** Chhattisgarh Rajya Hathkargha Vikas Evam Vipanan Sahkari Sangh Maryadit B-26, Sector-07, New Rajendra Nagar, Raipur Phone/Fax: 0771-4059181
Tags: Education, Examination, School, Student, Weaver

Scheme Name: Gadiya Lohar Raw Material Purchase Grant-in-aid Scheme
Eligibility Criteria:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should belong to the Gadiya Lohar community.
Description & Benefits:
Under this scheme, the state government provides financial assistance of ₹10,000/- as a one-time grant to the Gadia Lohar community of Rajasthan for purchasing raw materials and making themselves self-reliant in their business.

  - Under this scheme, the member of Gadia Lohar community of Rajasthan receives a one-time financial grant of ₹10,000/- to purchase raw materials for their business.
Application Process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Social Welfare Office.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Social Welfare Office to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).
